summary: The 'Providing Resources and Occupational Training for Emotional Crisis and Trauma in 911 Act' (PROTECT 911 Act) addresses mental health issues among public safety telecommunicators. It mandates the Secretary of Health and Human Services to develop and make public best practices for identifying, preventing, and treating PTSD and co-occurring disorders. It also requires the development of resources for educating mental health professionals about the unique stressors faced by 911 operators. The bill provides grants for emergency communication centers to establish or enhance behavioral health and wellness programs.
